trial_identification.studytitle: Amniotic membrane extract eye drops for eye surface diseases.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of amniotic membrane extract eye drops on promoting epithelialization and suppressing inflammation in patients with ocular surface diseases.

conditions.healthcondition: The efficacy of amniotic membrane extract in the treatment of ocular surface diseases with inflammation and epithelial disorders.

interventions.interventions: Amniotic membrane extract (AME) eye drops are made from amniotic membrane which has been widely used as a patch or graft for ocular surface diseases. AME is applied one drop (0.1ml) every hour for the first week, then every two hours untill complete epithelialization, then 4 times a day untill inflammation subsides. The patients enrolled might have prior failed amniotic membrane transplantation (AMT).

primaryOutcome.outcome: mean epithelialization time, the epithelialization is measured by fluorescein stainning under slit lamp examination
primaryOutcome.timepoint: every other day during first week, then 2, 3 weeks, 1, 2, 3, 6, 12 months following treatment.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: ocular surface diseases with epithelial disorders and inflammation
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: trichiasis, palpebral conjunctiva scar, limbal stem cell dificiency, corneal perforation

fundingsource.fundingname: Scientific and Technological Committee of Guangdong Province, China (2006B36006002)

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Now it is well accepted that amniotic membrane transplantation (AMT) as a temporary patch,or as a permanent graft is effective in treating inflammatory ocular diseases with epithelial defect. We hypothesis that amniotic membrane extract will be equally effective in treating those diseases, and also can avoid the surgical insult to the eye.
